question_text: A company has AWS Lambda functions that use environment variables. The company does not want its developers to see environment variables in plaintext. Which solution will meet these requirements?

options.A: Deploy code to Amazon EC2 instances instead of using Lambda functions.
options.B: Configure SSL encryption on the Lambda functions to use AWS CloudHSM to store and encrypt the environment variables.
options.C: Create a certificate in AWS Certificate Manager (ACM). Configure the Lambda functions to use the certificate to encrypt the environment variables.
options.D: Create an AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) key. Enable encryption helpers on the Lambda functions to use the KMS key to store and encrypt the environment variables.
